title: Basics
description: A graduated series of 50 Dhamma talks for meditators, starting with breath meditation and leading through issues of discernment. An expanded version of this series (64 talks) is available on youtube.

title: The Seven Factors of Awakening
description: A series of 7 Dhamma talks following one of the sets of the Buddha’s fundamental teachings from the 37 Wings to Awakening.

title: The Five Strengths
description: A series of 5 Dhamma talks following one of the sets of the Buddha’s fundamental teachings from the 37 Wings to Awakening.

title: The Eightfold Path
description: The Noble Eightfold Path forms the framework for all the Buddha’s teachings. It was the first topic he mentioned in his first sermon, and the last topic he mentioned in his last. The edited transcripts of these talks are available in eBook form as The Noble Eightfold Path: 13 Meditations Talks on the eBooks page.

talks.title: Right Mindfulness - The First Frame of Reference
Right Mindfulness - The Second Frame of Reference
Right Mindfulness - The Third Frame of Reference
Right Mindfulness - The Fourth Frame of Reference
Right Concentration - The Uses of Right Concentration
Sutta Reading: The Five Recollections (Anguttara Nikaya 5.57)
Sutta Reading: Afflicted in Body (Samyutta Nikaya 22.2)
Dhamma Talk: Preparing to Die Well
Sutta Reading: The Sick Ward (Samyutta Nikaya 36.7)
Chant: Verses on the Noble Truths
Dhamma Talk: Don't Worry, Be Focused (new)
Meditation: Guided Breath Meditation & How to Exit Meditation

title: With Each & Every Breath
description: Thanissaro Bhikkhu’s meditation guide With Each & Every Breath lists recommended Dhamma talks at the end of each chapter. Those talks are presented here in that same order.

talks.title: A Refuge from Illness, Aging, & Death
For the Survival of Your Goodness
A Meditator is a Good Friend to Have
Cutting New Paths in the Mind
On the Path of the Breath

title: Four Guardian Meditations
description: Four meditations to protect you from your defilements.

title: Guided Meditations
description: Guided breath and metta meditations with 5 to 10 minute pauses for experimenting with the instructions.

talks.title: Breath (40m - with steps for leaving meditation)

title: Chants
description: Pali chanting by the monks of Metta Forest Monastery

talks.title: Praise and Salutation to the Triple Gem
Reflection at the Moment of Using the Requisites
Praise and Salutation to the Triple Gem
Reflection at the Moment of Using the Requisites
Dhamma-cakkappavattana Sutta | Setting the Wheel of Dhamma in Motion
The Divine Mantra | Purification of the Six Properties
